name: Predicting the price of diamond
how_toy: The competition is explicitly compared to a learning environment and has a nominal prize of $1. Quote: 'The competition here, like Kaggle's playground, uses synthetic data.' and 'Prizes & Awards $1 Does not award Points or Medals'.
how_transparency: The competition provides transparency into the origin and creation of the dataset. Quote: 'The dataset for this competition (both train and test) was generated from a deep learning model trained on the diamonds.'

name: üì¢ PySphere Movie Review Sentiment Challenge
how_toy: The competition is explicitly for learning and has no cash prize. The text states it is a 'beginner-friendly introduction to Natural Language Processing' and 'Created for educational purposes'. It also specifies 'TOTAL PRIZES AVAILABLE: $0 (Free, Public, and Open-Source Competition). This competition is for learning, skill-building, and community engagement.'
how_transparency: The competition rules require winning solutions to be reproducible. The rules state a winner's obligation is to 'Provide the complete training and inference code' and 'The winning code must be shared in a public GitHub repository with sufficient documentation to allow full reproducibility of the results.'

name: SBU_data_science_5
how_data_privacy: The text states that the dataset was explicitly anonymized to protect privacy: 'While the original sensitive information has been carefully replaced with synonyms and generic identifiers to ensure privacy and focus on the underlying patterns, the dataset retains its richness for comprehensive feature engineering.'
how_toy: The competition is explicitly framed as an educational exercise for a university course and offers no significant prizes: 'This is a skills-based data-science exercise for Shahid Beheshti University's Data Science Course (Exercise 5).' and 'Prizes & Awards Kudos Does not award Points or Medals'.
how_transparency: The competition rules enforce reproducibility by requiring participants to submit code that can replicate their results: 'After the deadline you must upload to the course classroom (Google Classroom) a notebook or script that reproduces your best public-leaderboard score without internet access. Scores that can‚Äôt be reproduced lose credit.'

name: SPARTA 2024 Data Science Competition
how_toy: The competition is tagged as 'Beginner' and does not offer significant rewards, indicating an educational or practice focus. The prize section states: 'Prizes & Awards Kudos Does not award Points or Medals'.
how_transparency: The competition rules emphasize reproducibility by requiring participants to use seeds in their models. One of the disqualification criteria is: 'Tidak menggunakan seed pada notebook, sehingga hasil tidak dapat direproduksi.' (Not using a seed in the notebook, so the results cannot be reproduced.)

name: Jigsaw - Agile Community Rules Classification
how_data_privacy: The rules include a 'Data Security' clause mandating the secure handling of competition data by participants: "You agree to use reasonable and suitable measures to prevent persons who have not formally agreed to these Rules from gaining access to the Competition Data. You agree not to transmit, duplicate, publish, redistribute or otherwise provide or make available the Competition Data to any party not participating in the Competition."
how_transparency: The rules require winners to submit code and documentation to ensure reproducibility: "You may be required by the Sponsor to provide a detailed description of how the winning Submission was generated... The description should also include a link to a code repository with complete and detailed instructions so that the results obtained can be reproduced."

name: Kschool 10 Master Data Science Abr 2025
how_toy: The competition is for learning and does not offer significant rewards, as indicated by the rules and prizes section. Quote: 'Does not award Points or Medals' and 'Recuerda que el objetivo es aprender y disfrutar.' (Remember that the objective is to learn and enjoy.)
how_transparency: The competition provides a data dictionary to explain the variables, which is a form of dataset transparency. Quote: 'Descripcci√≥n Variables.xlsx - documento con descripcci√≥n de las variables' (document with a description of the variables).

name: Data Science Osaka Summer 2025
how_data_privacy: The rules explicitly restrict the use and distribution of the dataset. Quote: "This dataset has been specially provided exclusively for this competition. Any use outside of competition purposes is strictly prohibited." and "When sharing Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) publicly, please ensure to use sampled data rather than the complete dataset."
how_toy: The competition offers merchandise ('Swag') instead of a significant monetary prize and does not grant official Kaggle ranking points, indicating it's for learning and practice. Quote: "Prize link keyboard_arrow_up ÂÑ™Âãù„ÉÅ„Éº„É† : Swag" and "Does not award Points or Medals".
how_transparency: The competition details the evaluation process, including the model and formula used, and encourages participants to publicly share their solutions after the competition. Quote: "This competition adopts an LLM-as-a-Judge approach... name: International Medical AI and Data Science Calorie
how_data_privacy: The rules contain a 'Data Security' section that governs the handling of the competition dataset: "You agree to use reasonable and suitable measures to prevent persons who have not formally agreed to these Rules from gaining access to the Competition Data. You agree not to transmit, duplicate, publish, redistribute or otherwise provide or make available the Competition Data to any party not participating in the Competition."
how_toy: The competition is explicitly framed as a learning tool within the 'Playground Series' for participants to "practice their machine learning skills." The 'About' section states its goal is to "provide the Kaggle community with a variety of fairly light-weight challenges that can be used to learn and sharpen skills." It also offers no significant prizes, only "Kudos".
how_transparency: The competition provides transparency regarding the dataset's origin and creation method: "The dataset for this competition (both train and test) was generated from a deep learning model trained on the Calories Burnt Prediction dataset."

name: NeurIPS - Ariel Data Challenge 2025
how_data_privacy: The competition rules explicitly mention data security and use restrictions for the provided dataset. It states: "You agree to use reasonable and suitable measures to prevent persons who have not formally agreed to these Rules from gaining access to the Competition Data... You may access and use the Competition Data for non-commercial purposes only..."
how_transparency: The competition rules require winners to provide detailed descriptions and code to ensure their results can be reproduced. Quote: "The description should also include a link to a code repository with complete and detailed instructions so that the results obtained can be reproduced."

name: FDS Summer Challenge 2025 - Weather Prediction
